bioghist.p: The Dutch naturalist Hendrik Elingsz van Rijgersma was born in 1835 in Lemmer, Province of Friesland, the Netherlands. He studied medicine and became a physician in 1858, and worked as a physician in the town of Jisp and thereafter on the island of Marken. Van Rijgersma served as the government physician on the island St. Martin in Netherlands Antilles from 1863 until his death in 1877.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of illustrations made by Rijgersma and include a volume of watercolor drawings of flowers from St. Martin znd an unbound set of signatures containing watercolor illustrations of seashells of the Antilles. The illustrations include scientific names (several also include common names) and brief descriptions. Some of the text is in Dutch. Both sets of illustrations have been published. The collection also includes a letter from Edward Drinker Cope to van Rijgersma (1869).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
